column4: Hi! When trying to access my other HardDrives I get "Unabled to mount: Not authorized"
I have some really important stuff to back up
can anyone please help me
you need root rights
how do I show my hard drives
the best thing is to look what you got in /dev/ there are all your partitions listed
do that in your command line 'ls /dev/sd*'
without the ' ' of course ;)
you can use fdisk too... but it need sudo rights...
correct
but ther are tools that will do the mounting for you automatically if it is a pendrive
hm.... i was in your situation a looooooooong time ago... sorry i can not remeber the name... google for it a bit and you will find as i did
but if you need the mount only one time then forget about the tools
do you have any idea what the name is
yes just one time
ok, so you want to backup files from a partition
did you allready mount the partition?
with the command you said...  sudo mount /dev/sdd1 /home/myUser/Desktop/USB
fermiAnyone: thank you
thanks very much
so your problem is solved?
